comment._content: they lived at 118 E 56 St, New York Early supporters of birth control and she was a prominent sufferagette. Records often have it as deR or DeR the social register has it as deR books.google.com/books?id=3EtIAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA713&l...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry in Wikipedia on her: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vira_Boarman_Whitehouse James Norman de Rapelye Whitehouse (1858-1949)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: This photo, dated in January, 1914, may have been taken when Mrs. Whitehouse, a prominent American Suffragette leader, was aboard ship in New York harbor, preparing to sail to Germany. In Berlin, along with other Americans, she was presented (by the American Ambassador) to Kaiser Wilhelm II and the Imperial German Court. New York Times story, January 18, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A07E4D81F3BE6...

comment._content:
Two Bain/LOC photos of Mrs. Whitehouse addressing an outdoor political assembly in New York City:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4669375444/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4647772300/]

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: And one from July 5, 1915 when she headed the Empire State Campaign Committee (backing the suffrage issue on the ballot in New York) and Grand Marshal of the Suffrage Parade.
